file_content.text: The crown is being hidden away. We will announce we have it at an expedient time.
Captain, I admire your principles, but it is clear Organa offers no help on what matters most to House Panteer.
You need not try to sell House Panteer on Thul alliances again, Fixer. But who are these?
What do your lot want to do with the captain of the Queensguard?
You need not try to sell me again on House Thul, Fixer. But who is this?
What do you want with the Queensguard, stranger?
I recovered this from the river. You know what it is.
I have the Panteer crown.
That's... that is, quite frankly, unbelievable. We will, of course, analyze it to determine if it is a fake.
I bring something from Sir Deris to Captain Lieber.
Sir Deris sent me.
I know Deris, and I know that, were he able, he would deliver this prize himself.
First feast your eyes... then beg.
Watch and I will show you.
That is hardly the diplomatic way to--I see.
I came to sell you a planetary symbol of rulership. Slightly used.
I've got something priceless.
You cannot be serious.
If that is genuine, it is worth the lives of every man here and then some.
Captain, surely this will sway your vaunted neutrality? The Empire and House Thul giving you--
The symbolism does not escape me, Fixer. But that crown has never changed hands without enormous cost.
What do you seek in return for the crown? An alliance, or merely a deal?
You can't put a price on peace. So, start handing me credits until I say "stop."
I want personal compensation.
But what of House Thul? We require a Panteer alliance and your loyalty to our Empire--
You have neither credits nor crown in your hands, Fixer.
What I see here are many mouths, many obligations. It is fair that this team will be... financed.
I had not imagined the Sith to be so... financially motivated, but credits are a lesser currency than blood and loyalty. I will pay.
We have dealt with mercenary avarice before. We are not without means.
Do not think this independence will go unnoticed by the Empire.
Ignore him. Yours are unlikely hands to have brought the crown home, but on such chances our future turns.
In the end, what I ask is that the crown go on a Thul head.
Honor the Empire.
House Thul's crimes are great, but Organa has proven itself no better.
To retrieve this must have taken courage. If Thul commands such virtue these days, perhaps we can look beyond old transgressions.
You are to be commended. Many in your position would have taken full financial advantage.
How fortunate for the Empire it was you who held it.
We are neither friend nor enemy. That is all you must know.
